column4: hi all. using ubuntu 10.04, ive got the partitions shown at http://tinypic.com/view.php?pic=2wlspjo&s=7 . i tried gparted live cd to resize sd6 (my ubuntu partition) and take all free space, but i cannot resize, nor move none of the partitions. how can i do what i want> TIA!
I presume you're trying to edit your only OS partition from a Live CD?
Good.  do you see the lock icons next to the partitions?
That means the partitions are currently mounted.  Right click and then unmount and you should be able to edit them.
Note that you cannot resize the extended partition without first unmounting ALL logical ones.
how do i unmount those logical partitions?

It will automatically mount them, but don't worry; you can unmount them and they'll be fine.  Mounted just means that you can access the data on them and you can use them (like your swap is mounted so your Live CD is currently using it, I believe.  You might need to do something in the terminal before you can unmount it).
Read what I wrote earlier.  (That means the...)
Actually, that may not have been super clear.  Right click, and you'll see a menu.  On that, click "unmount".
There will only be a few options that aren't gray-ed out.
start stop ubuntu immediately?  Do you mean it doesn't give you a chance to select another partition to boot from?
rite. i'd like it to start ubuntu immediately. ive read its possible but all documentation i find is complicated for me
